phaseGroups.description: * Front-line health workers

* Persons ages ≥75 years
* Frontline critical workers
* Those working or living in congregate settings
* First responders including firefighters and law enforcement
* Persons ages 65-74 years

* People ages 55-64
* People ages 16-64 years with high-risk medical conditions
* People with intellectual and developmental disabilities
* Additional critical workers
* General public

* Health care workers
* Long-term care staff and residents
* Frontline EMS and fire service personnel providing medical services

* Persons aged 55 or older
* Persons aged 50-54 with a high-risk medical condition
* Frontline essential workers aged 50-54
* Pandemic response staff
* Educators
* People living or working in congregate settings
* Persons aged 16 and above who: are essential workers, have certain medical conditions, live in a multigenerational household, or live in “unserved communities”
* General population (individuals aged 16+)

Still to be determined: 

* Children under 16

* Health care workers
* Emergency medical workers
* Long-term care facility staff and residents

* Education and child care workers
* Adults 65 and older
* Protective services occupations (law enforcement, corrections, etc.)

Moving forward, eligibility will be primarily determined by age. Eligibility will vary across counties and tribes, which may also choose to prioritize certain additional frontline workers. Counties are now vaccinating:

* Age group 65+ (Santa Cruz)
* Age group 55+ (Apache, Graham, Maricopa, Mohave, Pima, Yavapai, Yuma)
* Age group 16+ or 18+ (Coconino, Cochise, Gila, Graham, Greenlee, La Paz, Navajo, Pinal, Yuma)

(NEW) State-run sites in Maricopa, Pima, and Yuma counties are now vaccinating age group 16+

Still to be determined:

* General population and individuals under 16

* Health care workers
* Long-term care residents and staff
* First responders

* People ages 65 and older
* Teacher and child care workers
* Manufacturing workers

* Essential government and community workers
* People with intellectual or developmental disabilities

* People 16-64 with high-risk medical conditions
* Additional essential workers
* People residing in high-risk settings (incarceration/detention facilities, group homes, congregate settings, crowded housing, student housing)
* (NEW) Veterans of all ages

Still to be determined: 

* General public and under 16

* Health care workers
* Long-term care residents

Now vaccinating as supplies allow (varies locally):

* Adults 65+
* Education and child care 
* Emergency services
* Food and agriculture

* Adults aged 16 to 64 with certain high-risk health conditions and disabilities
* Adults living or working in congregate settings (incarceration/detention facilities, homeless shelters, behavioral health facilities, etc.)
* Public transit workers

Certain counties and localities may be vaccinating additional groups.
* General public

Still to be determined: 

* Individuals under 16
